content:
I will use the `Protocol` agent.
My reasoning for choosing the `Protocol` agent is to apply the new optimization hypothesis (Hypothesis-360c) to the existing experimental procedure (Protocol-b5fc). This agent is designed to adjust or modify an existing procedure based on new information or feedback.

I will fill the `experiment_name` parameter with "enzymatic de novo DNA synthesis of ACTCTGAT" as this is the ongoing experiment.
I will fill the `file_ids` parameter with a list containing "Protocol-b5fc" and "Hypothesis-360c". "Protocol-b5fc" represents the current best experimental procedure before the last failed attempt (which resulted in a rollback). "Hypothesis-360c" contains the new optimization advice to be incorporated into the procedure.
I will fill the `manuals` parameter with a list containing "beads-manual" and "3-ONH2-dnTP-manual". These manuals were identified as relevant during the initial reagent check and should continue to be available for procedure refinement.
I will set the `pure_software` parameter to `False` because this experiment involves physical hardware and reagents.
I will set the `retry` parameter to `False` because I am applying a specific optimization hypothesis, not regenerating a procedure due to multiple failures.

args.experiment_name: enzymatic de novo DNA synthesis of ACTCTGAT
